com.garmin.health

Interface DeviceConnectionStateListener


  • public interface DeviceConnectionStateListener
    Provides callbacks to be notified when the connection state of the device changes.
    See Also:
    AbstractDeviceManager.addConnectionStateListener(com.garmin.health.DeviceConnectionStateListener)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onDeviceConnected(Device device)
      Called when the device has connected and is ready to communicate.
      void onDeviceConnectionFailed(Device device, FailureCode failure)
      Called when a connection attempt to a device fails and cannot be automatically retried.
      void onDeviceDisconnected(Device device)
      Called when the device disconnects.
      default void onServiceDisconnected()
      Called when the Garmin Health service has been severed.

    • Method Detail

      • onDeviceConnected

        void onDeviceConnected(Device device)
        Called when the device has connected and is ready to communicate. This notification will lag behind the raw Bluetooth connection event as this waits for the device to set up the communication channel before firing.
        Parameters:
        device - the device that connected

      • onDeviceDisconnected

        void onDeviceDisconnected(Device device)
        Called when the device disconnects.
        Parameters:
        device - the device that disconnected

      • onDeviceConnectionFailed

        void onDeviceConnectionFailed(Device device,
                              FailureCode failure)
        Called when a connection attempt to a device fails and cannot be automatically retried.
        Parameters:
        device - the device that failed to connect
        failure - the cause of the failure

      • onServiceDisconnected

        default void onServiceDisconnected()
        Called when the Garmin Health service has been severed. Further communication should not be attempted until the service has restarted and been rebound. This method will not be called unless the Health SDK is implemented using the service communication. To determine the cause of service failure please review the logs for the process running the Garmin Health service.
